title: Castaways-War-One-Mans-Battle-Imperial-Japan.mp3
description:
John Batchelor may 2, 2016 book author interview mp3

The Castaway's War: One Man's Battle against Imperial Japan by Stephen Harding.

â€œStephen Harding is an extraordinary historian, has somehow found a virtually unknown story about World War II, then told that story with such detail and precision that it comes aliveâ€”and is impossible to put down. The Castawayâ€™s War reads like a thriller, proving again that true history has a punch that few novelists ever achieve.â€â€”Alan Furst, bestselling author of Dark Star and Night Soldiers

â€œStephen Harding has done it again! He has somehow found a truly extraordinary story from World War II that has all the elements of a Hollywood thriller or adventure movie, and yet is true in every regard. Weâ€™re all familiar with the stories of sole Japanese who stayed in obscure island jungles fighting on after the peace, but here is its exact mirror image: an American who fought on during wartime on an island from which he had no hope of escape. Unbroken meets The Sands of Iwo Jima.â€â€”Andrew Roberts, author of Napoleon and The Storm of War

â€œStephen Harding pulls back the jungle canopy on Arundel Island to uncover a riveting story of courage and resilience from World War II. The Castawayâ€™s War weaves together meticulous research and gripping storytelling to bring alive a story that transcends the war. At its heart, this is a book about finding the inner strength to battle on.â€â€”Brian Murphy, author of 81 Days below Zero
